Name: C KAIAPO TLP
Notes: 5/8" threaded bolt on top of concrete pillar. Mark name changed from "C Kaiapo TLP IGNS" to "C Kaiapo TLP" on 1 September 2014.

Name: Akitio Station
Notes: GPS site near Panui Trig A3MQ on Akitio Station.

Name: Anaura Bay
Notes: Grassy ridge top by intersection of fences.

Name: Aratiatia Dam
Notes: Concrete pillar with 3 stainless rods drilled to 0.5m into concrete butress.  Note that between 2006-10-12 and 2006-11-08 the existing pillar adjacent to this one was occupied using the code ATIA, as a test.

Name: Aratiatia Dam
Notes: Test deployment for site ARTA

Name: Whangaparaoa No 3
Notes: Site upgraded to Trimble NETRS/Trimble Zephyr combination on 3rd November 2005. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-06-27

Name: Auckland Tide Gauge
Notes: Mark name changed from "Auckland Tide Gauge CGPS" to "Auckland Tide Gauge" on 2 Sep. 2014.

Name: Black Hill Station
Notes: Hard rock (greywacke) at surface.

Name: Bluff
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 120 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in concrete pillar. Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2016-05-10

Name: 8A Balmoral Lane
Notes: front yard of red zone house in Red Cliffs

Name: Burnett Rock
Notes: Mark name changed from "Coxs Downs" to "Burnett Rock" on 1 Sep 2014.

Name: Battery Hill
Notes: **Landowner contact established December 2007 (Annie Douglas).  Visited and permitted by Lara 30.04.08.

Name: Chatham Island
Notes: name changed from "Chatham Island IGS" to "Chatham Island" on Sep. 2014

Name: Chatham Island North
Notes: Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-06-27

Name: Cape Kidnappers
Notes: Replace trig B16N. No rock outcropping, only clay/mudstone. data comms mast installed to the south of the GNSS antenna the 3rd of April 2017.

Name: Clarence River
Notes: 2016-13-11 M7.8 Kaikoura event response (scientific target: postseismic signal). Temporary site (LRR1) in the vicinity of the deep braced monument

Name: 92 Richmond Hill Road
Notes: monument removed to allow for retaining work

Name: 8 Kinsey Terrace
Notes: Equipment has been dismantled on 2016-04-26 after vandalism and theft. The monument has been left on place.

Name: Clifton Hill
Notes: Site used for landslide monitoring. Mark has been dismantled on 2016-08-28.

Name: Cape Campbell No. 2
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in 320 mm diameter concrete pillar. Pillar plate is 1601 mm above the top of previous mark (A Cape Campbell B28C).

Name: Coromandel
Notes: Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2016-05-10

Name: Dannevirke
Notes: Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2016-05-10

Name: Dunedin
Notes: Mark name changed from "Trig T1 No.2" to "Dunedin" on 1 Sep 2014. Full GNSS capability enabled on 2015-03-09

Name: Faleolo
Notes: IGS Pacific site. Post is cemented into a hole excavated approximately 1m deep in weathered igneous bedrock. Geodetic reference point is top-center of steel coupler atop steel mast.

Name: Gladstone Station Temporary
Notes: temporary mark deployed for M7.8 Kaikoura earthquake sequence monitoring. will be replaced by GDST.  Tribrach found out of level on 2017-02-22 and readjusted at the same time of the NetR9 receiver swap.

Name: Gisborne
Notes: Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2016-05-10

Name: Golden Bay
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 100 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in concrete pillar. Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2016-05-10

Name: Gracefield
Notes: GNS site moved from Gracefield to Avalon, Lower Hutt.

Name: Grange Hill
Notes: This land is broad and flat with incised gullies (100m+ between gullies).  Stratigraphy in the road cut shows flat lying layered seds and there is iron cemented river gravel in the gullies.  No obvious options for seismic testing.

Name: Gunn Ridge
Notes: ON LARGE LANDSLIDE. Analysis of the data shows GUNR is moving atypically for regional tectonics and compared to nearby stations (eg MTPR). Affected by large landslide (also scarp visible to North). More info in resolved RT ticket 57397.

Name: Haast
Notes: See place 'Jackson Bay' for VSAT info.  Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Hamilton
Notes: A Repeater approx 1 km south links to our Comms Hub at the LINZ Office Hamilton. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Hanmer Basin
Notes: Forms Hope Fault transect with Marble Point (MRBL)

Name: Hastings
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 100 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in 400 mm diameter concrete pillar. Pillar plate is 735 mm above the top of previous mark (Roys Hill - A4F2). Mark name changed from "Roys Hill No2" to "Hastings" on Sep. 2014. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Hicks Bay
Notes: Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Hokitika
Notes: Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Hoophorn Spur
Notes: Mark name changed from "Mount Hodgkinson" to "Hoophorn Spur" on Sep 2014.

Name: Kahuranaki
Notes: Hill just to NNE of Trig 1238. 9m tall data comms mast installed at 3m south of the antenna on 2017-05-02

Name: Kaikoura
Notes: Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Kooro
Notes: Aeolian Dunes.

Name: Kaitaia
Notes: Mark name changed from "Kaitaia Tatarakihi" to "Kaitaia" on Sep 2014. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Te Kuta
Notes: Broad flat hill

Name: Lauder NIWA Station
Notes: Located at NIWA atmospheric research station. Site code has been changed from LAUD to LDRZ at the beginning of 2015.

Name: Alexandra
Notes: Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2013-05-02.

Name: Lake Taylor
Notes: Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Glen Orkney Station Temporary
Notes: temporary mark deployed for M7.8 Kaikoura earthquake sequence monitoring. will be replaced by GLOK

Name: Lookout Mountain
Notes: On a spur 600m to the West of the peak of Lookout Mountain

Name: Clarence River Temporary
Notes: temporary mark set to monitor 2016-11-13 M7.8 Kaikoura earthquake sequence. Will be replaced by a drilled braced monument (CLRR)

Name: Mahoenui
Notes: antenna mount wasn't tightened properly from 2011-01-11 to 2011-05-17. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Masterton
Notes: Mark name changed from "Tiffin No. 2" to "Masterton" on Sept 2014. MAST site has been decomissioned on 2016-04-06 because a house has been built close to the site. WRPA site is ~ 150m apart and is considered as MAST replacement within the PositioNZ network. Pillar has been destroyed and a survey mark installed  on 8 June 2016.

Name: Mavora Lakes
Notes: full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-05-05T01:28:13

Name: McNeill Hill
Notes: NOTE: there are major landslides off all faces of McNeill Hill but the top area selected for GPS and seismic is considered stable (from lanslide report by Nick Perrin).  The landslides are thought to be ancient and are probably not active, as there is no evidence of recent displacement.

Name: Methven
Notes: all legs are short - 5.5m central leg and 6m N/S/E/W legs - as very coarse gravel/boulders encountered. Full GNSS capability enabled on 2016-04-11T17:09:38 UTC.

Name: Squally Cove; Western Marlborough Sounds
Notes: Hikurangi margin array (scientific target: SS events)

Name: Rai Valley
Notes: Hikurangi margin array (scientific target: SS events)

Name: Spooners Range
Notes: Hikurangi margin array (scientific target: SS events)

Name: Waihopai Valley Road
Notes: Hikurangi margin array (scientific target: SS events)

Name: South of Awatere Valley Road
Notes: Part of northern MF system transect

Name: Spenser Mountains
Notes: Determine uplift vertical rates (Russ Van Dissen)

Name: Culverden
Notes: Add on to southern MF system transect

Name: West of Lincoln
Notes: This will be using an exising Trimble installation - site abandoned

Name: Minginui
Notes: CDMA

Name: McQueens Valley
Notes: Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-06-27

Name: Marble Point
Notes: Forms Hope Fault transect with HANM  (Moved from original position north of Hanmer by Laura W and Rob L)

Name: Mount Blewitt No. 2
Notes: Note:  cGPS monument drilled approx 5m WNW from existing trig.  The trig is fenced off with the cGPS monument inside the post and rail enclosure with max enclosure size = 30 sq metres.  No access without contacting the landowner first.

Name: Mt John Observatory
Notes: MTJO links to VSAT at LBZ via a Repeater close by LBZ. Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2015-05-20

Name: Mt. Quoin
Notes: A steal rod is marked in a small meter deep, vegetation free gully near the ridge crest approximately 100 meters from the summit area.

Name: Muller Station Temporary
Notes: temporary mark deployed for M7.8 Kaikoura earthquake sequence monitoring. will be replaced by MULR

Name: Niue Meteorological Station
Notes: Starting from 2014-03-13T01:30 the station is operated and maintained by Geoscience Australia.

Name: Nelson
Notes: Mark name changed from "HM Hemi Matanga No. 2" to "Nelson" on Sept 2014. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26

Name: Naumai
Notes: The site is on limestone which dips about 18 degrees to the SE from a measurement close to the site.

Name: New Plymouth
Notes: Mark name changed from "German Hill No. 2" to "New Plymouth" on Sept 2014. Full GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-04

Name: North Range Road
Notes: Note this site is on the same land as seismic site at place Post Office Road.

Name: Ohingaiti
Notes: There are numerous shallow, surface slumps in the area but Nick is of the opinion that these will not affect a site on the broad flat top of the hill.

Name: Opotiki
Notes: Flat grassy hill top.  Geology Unknown.  Easy access with 4x4 in dry conditions.

Name: Cape Palliser
Notes: The drillers had problems with hole collapse at this site so it is effectively now a short-braced monument with legs grouted in place.  BORELOG: All holes are in soft brown fractured Greywacke: North leg - GL to 3m, hole collapsing back to 3m; South leg - GL to 1.5m, hole collapsing back at 1.5m; East and centre legs - GL to 1.8m, holes collapsing back to 1.8m; West leg - GL to 3.2m, hole collapsing back to  3.2m.  Mark name changed from "Cape Palliser CGPS" to "Cape Palliser" on Sept 2014

Name: Paritu Road
Notes: Broad exposed slab of sandstone.  Build should stay away from the bouldery edges.

Name: Pukenui
Notes: Helicopter access.

Name: Porangahau
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 50 mm diameter stainless steel centre block of deep braced monument. Top of SS centre block is 1273 mm above the top of previous mark geodetic mark 30 (Poranagahau SD) - A47A.  Mark name changed from "30 No. 2 Porangahau" to "Porangahau" on Sept 2014.

Name: Paparatu
Notes: Broad grassy hill with ute access to site.  Site is adjacent to fence on flat ground that used to be a farm track.

Name: Puketoi
Notes: Base of old airstrip. Avoid edge of airstrip as is likely to be infill.

Name: Puysegur Point
Notes: Full GNSS capability enabled on 2016-06-29

Name: Arahi
Notes: Broad hill top with hard limestone; band continues around the hill.  Good seismic test.

Name: Raukumara Range
Notes: A GPS site was taken at each of two hills - Puketoetoe and Puketoetoe No 2.  The two sites were tested.  The seismic data from hill 2 was preferable, therefore a combined site on hill 2 is favourable.

Name: Richmond Range
Notes: Hikurangi margin array (scientific target: SS events)

Name: Ardelve
Notes: acceptable site on broad knoll next to a property boundary fence.

Name: Kaharoa
Notes: Deep braced monument into pumice/ash and mamaku ignimbrite at depth.  5/8 thread on top of monument.

Name: Kawerau
Notes: Deep Braced Monument.

Name: Lichenstein Road
Notes: Concrete pillar constructed using concrete pipe above rods rammed into approx 1m cubed hole; hole filled with concrete. Subsrate is layered friable ash and pumice tephra which is easy to dig.

Name: Ongahoro
Notes: Broad flat grassy hill.

Name: Republican Road
Notes: Deep braced monument

Name: Tarawera
Notes: some legs are not deep-braced, only shallow, due to poor drilling conditions.

Name: Utuhina
Notes: Concrete pillar constructed using concrete pipe above rods rammed into approx 1m cubed hole; hole filled with concrete.

Name: White Island Crater Floor
Notes: The monument legs were rammed into the ground to approximately 3m depth below the surface.

Name: White Island Summit
Notes: Short braced monument with legs rammed to ~5m depth

Name: Waikite Valley Road
Notes: Broad grassy hill. Ignimbrite bedrock nearby and likely contactable at depth with Deep braced monument.

Name: Scott Base
Notes: Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2015-09-21

Name: Seddon
Notes: (Previously CLIF) Site is in grassy paddock (sheep at present); positioned ~80 m SSW from gate. Site is marked with a pink painted metal stake.

Name: Shannon Station
Notes: Located ~15 meters south of Puiarau Trig.  Site is on a flat grassy spot next to a farm track and marked with paint.  Ute should be able to drive to site when dry.

Name: Sutton
Notes: Planned to support Pilar Vilamor 'Hidden Faults Under Cities' in the Dunedin Region

Name: Auckland Tide Gauge
Notes: TAKL was decommissioned because the building to which it was attached is being moved by Ports of Auckland. The receiver was switched off at 03:44 UT 5 July 2007.  The site has been re-established at a new location with a new 4-letter code (AUKT).  Mark name changed from "Auckland Tide Gauge CGPS" to "Auckland Tide Gauge" on Sep 2014.

Name: Taupo Airport
Notes: Full GNSS capability installed on 2016-07-04

Name: Te Maipa
Notes: Site is on top Pukekowhai ridge. Helicopter access for build. Foot access from good farm track along ridge.

Name: Lake Tennyson Temporary
Notes: temporary mark deployed for M7.8 Kaikoura earthquake sequence monitoring. will be replaced by TENN

Name: Lake Tennyson
Notes: Forms MF system transect with MG14

Name: Horomatangi Reef
Notes: Braced stainless steel pole mounted on the Horomatangi Reefs platform on the same pole as the lake levelling mark.

Name: Hingarae Road
Notes: Deep braced monument into welded Whakamaru ignimbrite.  5/8 thread on top of monument.

Name: Ouaha Hills
Notes: Deep braced monument into pumice/tephra overlying rhyolite dome.

Name: Rangitukua
Notes: Deep braced monument into rhyolite lava outcrop. 5/8 thread on top of monument.  BORELOG: North, South and East Legs - 0-3m soft brown ash; 3-6m banded lenticular rhyolite; 6-9/9.5m soft fractured lenticular rhyolite. West Leg - 0-3m soft brown ash; 3-6m banded lenticular rhyolite; 6-6.8m soft fractured lenticular rhyolite. West leg losing grout - 800 litres used on this leg. Centre leg - 0-2.6m soft brown ash; 2.6-6m banded lenticular rhyolite.

Name: Rihia Road
Notes: Concrete Pillar monument, 2m deep foundation hole with reinforcing extending into the concrete pipe.

Name: Te Kawerauta 1836
Notes: 5/8 thread in the top of the monument.  This monument replaces the mark known as Te Kawerauta 1836 at the same location.

Name: Taihape
Notes: Ridgeline formed from large andesite boulders.  Drive on access through paddock.

Name: Tintock
Notes: Comms hub at this site. Mudstone outcropping at surface

Name: Takaka Hill
Notes: Hikurangi margin array (scientific target: SS events) Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2016-09-12

Name: Tauranga
Notes: Full GNSS capability enabled on 2016-06-29T22:30:49

Name: Port Underwood
Notes: Hikurangi margin array (scientific target: SS events)

Name: Utiku Borehole 2
Notes: ONTRACK "PERMIT TO ENTER" REQUIRED TO WORK ACCESS LAND

Name: Utiku Borehole 3
Notes: ONTRACK "PERMIT TO ENTER" REQUIRED TO ACCESS SITE

Name: Utiku Borehole 4
Notes: ONTRACK "PERMIT TO ENTER" NEEDED TO ACCESS SITE

Name: Utiku Reference Station
Notes: Site is directly across SH1 from landslide where boreholes and monitoring equipment (piezometers and raingauges) are installed.  Land owned by:  Ivan and Vivian Michleson 06 388 0096 Home 027 231 9222 Ivan's mobile

Name: Vava'u
Notes: The VAVS antenna mast was exchanged on 9 June 2009.  The top of the new mast is 3 mm S, 17 mm W, 252 mm UP relative to the top of the old mast (accuracy is about 2 mm).  There will be an offset of this magnitude in the time series, plus any offset due to the change of antenna.

Name: Vexation
Notes: On 17/03/2015 the grub screw antenna insert has been found loose and oriented 20deg NE. Antenna has been been realigned to 0deg N and tightened.

Name: Dome
Notes: Concrete pillar made using formatube. Pillar damaged during september 25 2007 eruption, has gained an eastward tilt.  may no longer be stable. Email from Steve Currie with results from april08 survey From our crater rim deformation the changes (due to the damage) at your pillar relative to ITD3 (which is the mark on the adjacent knob ie the dome) are a movement (in NZMG) of 23mm south, 86mm east, a vector of 89mm) and has gone up? 3mm (this is close to survey uncertainty).

Name: Far West
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter concrete tube cast using a cardboard Formatube.

Name: Karewarewa
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter concrete tube cast using a cardboard Formatube.

Name: Moawhango Dam
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter PVC farm tuff tube filled with concrete.

Name: Mangateitei
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter concrete pipe. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Ngauruhoe
Notes: cGPS monument: short braced three leg + vertical 25 mm stainless steel rebar rammed not glued. Longest leg about 3.7 m. This site likely to have deep snow in winter.

Name: North Tongariro
Notes: Permanent occupation of the North Tongariro site. A temporary monument (VGT8) has been operational at the same location from 2013 to 2016

Name: Chateau Observatory
Notes: Antenna mount was misplaced from 2016-05-12T03:58 to 2016-08-22T20:28 (about 10mm higher than its correct position)

Name: Oturere
Notes: Used as a temporary pillar from 2004-05-16 to 2004-05-20. Reoccupied 2006-06-08. Concrete pillar bolted onto solid lava flow.

Name: Pokaka
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter concrete pipe.

Name: Te Maari 2
Notes: This is a mark created for the 2012 Tongariro Response and consists of an iron rod rammed into the ground.  A tripod was used to setup the antenna over the mark.  Site was buried in the 2012 eruption. Last data in the archive is from 2012-08-06

Name: Tongariro 8
Notes: monument dismantled on 2016-05-09 and replaced by VGNT.

Name: Turoa
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter concrete tube cast using a cardboard Formatube.

Name: Tukino Ski Field
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter concrete tube cast using a cardboard Formatube.

Name: Whangaehu Hut
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter concrete tube cast using a cardboard Formatube.

Name: Wahianoa
Notes: 5/8 thread in centre of 160 mm diameter stainless steel plate set in a 300 mm external diameter concrete tube cast using a cardboard Formatube.

Name: Waimate
Notes: WAIM is linked to the VSAT at ODZ by a Radio Repeater located on Mole Hill Station (Otahua Downs)close to ODZ. Mark name changed from "Trig S 76" to "Waimate" on Sep 2014. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Wanganui
Notes: This site requires a magnet key. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Warkworth
Notes: Located on a flat bench about 20 meters northwest of the equipment shelter. Full GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2013-03-20.

Name: Westport
Notes: Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Wellington Airport
Notes: Full GNSS capability enabled on 2016-06-13

Name: Wellington Tide Gauge
Notes: There is a 20dB in-line amplifier in the antenna cable to boost the signal from the LEIAT504 antenna to the NetRS.  The amplifier is GPS Networking p/n LA20RPDC-. Mark name changed from "Wellington Tide Gauge CGPS" to "Wellington Tide Gauge" on Sep 2014.

Name: Whakatane
Notes: Slightly sloping knoll next to farm track. Full-GNSS capability enabled on 2016-07-26.

Name: Whangarei
Notes: Full GNSS capability enabled on 2016-04-07

Name: Wairau Valley temporary
Notes: temporary mark set to monitor 2016-11-13 M7.8 Kaikoura earthquake sequence. Will be replaced by a drilled braced monument (WRAU)

Name: Wairau Valley
Notes: Hikurangi margin array (scientific target: SS events) and 2016-13-11 M7.8 Kaikoura event response (scientific target: postseismic signal). Temporary site (WRA1) in the vicinity of the deep braced monument

Name: Wairarapa
Notes: Full-GNSS capability (GPS, Glonass, Galielo, BeiDou, QZSS) enabled on 2016-03-17

Name: Yaldhurst
